snippet: Indictments that were unsealed on Tuesday charge nine companies and 44 people with defrauding a broad array of customers of fuel they believed had been delivered.
abstract: Manhattan district attorney's office accuses 44 people and nine companies of persistent, widespread heating oil fraud throughout New York City; says many customers were defrauded of up to 10 percent of oil they thought was being delivered.

byline.contributor: Emily Palmer, William K. Rashbaum and Rick Rojas contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Indictments that were unsealed on Tuesday charge nine companies and 44 people with defrauding a broad array of customers of fuel they believed had been delivered.

headline.main: Prosecutors Allege Persistent Heating Oil Fraud in New York City
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Allege Persistent Heating Oil Fraud in City
